metadata.title: CVE-2023-0240 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a logic error in io_uring's implementation which can be used totrigger a use-after-free vulnerability leading to privilege escalation. Inthe io_prep_async_work function the assumption that the lastio_grab_identity call cannot return false is not true, and in this case thefunction will use the init_cred or the previous linked requests identity todo operations instead of using the current identity. This can lead toreference counting issues causing use-after-free. We recommend upgradingpast version 5.10.161.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
